content.text:
# Revolutionary Unity Movement

MUR symbolMUR election posterMUR mural in OcotalThe Revolutionary Unity Movement (In Spanish: Movimiento de Unidad Revolucionaria - MUR) is a Nicaraguan  political party, founded in 1988 as a new Marxist party by defectors from the Marxist-Leninist Party of Nicaragua (PMLN), Nicaraguan Communist Party (PCdeN), and the Sandinista National Liberation Front (FSLN). Ex-FSLN member, Moisés Hassán, Managua's former Sandinista major, was the leader of the organization. MUR participated in the 1990 Nicaraguan Presidential Elections (with Hassan as its presidential candidate) and won one seat (out of 110) in the National Assembly.
The president of MUR (as of 2004) is Francisco Samper.[http://archivo.elnuevodiario.com.ni/2004/febrero/16-febrero-2004/nacional/nacional5.html El Nuevo Diario - "Bloquean a candidatos de la Convergencia"]
